dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Joe Biden's comeback on Super Tuesday was just... staggering. I mean, his campaign was basically written off after New Hampshire.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Joe Biden's comeback on Super Tuesday was just... staggering. I mean, his campaign was basically written off after New Hampshire.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The former vice president, whose campaign appeared to be on life support just weeks ago after a poor showing in Iowa, was resurgent across several key states and is projected to win the key state of Texas over favourite Bernie Sanders, with 30% of the vote, a narrow lead over Sanders 28.3%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And he ended up winning eight states, including Texas, which was a huge upset over Bernie Sanders. He got 31% there to Bernie's 27.9%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And he ended up winning eight states, including Texas, which was a huge upset over Bernie Sanders. He got thirty one percent there to Bernie's twenty seven point nine percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden wins nine states: The former vice president, whose campaign appeared to be on life support just weeks ago after a poor showing in Iowa, was resurgent across several key states and is projected to win the key state of Texas over favourite Bernie Sanders, with 30% of the vote, a narrow lead over Sanders 28.3%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and what's wild is he barely even campaigned in some of those states—like Arkansas, Alabama, Minnesota...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and what's wild is he barely even campaigned in some of those states-like Arkansas, Alabama, Minnesota...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also won in Arkansas, Alabama, Massachusetts, Oklahoma, Minnesota and Tennessee, but spent little to no time campaigning in those states, instead focusing on North Carolina and Virginia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh, he focused on North Carolina and Virginia instead, and it clearly paid off. His support among black and older voters really carried him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh, he focused on North Carolina and Virginia instead, and it clearly paid off. His support among black and older voters really carried him.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also won in Arkansas, Alabama, Massachusetts, Oklahoma, Minnesota and Tennessee, but spent little to no time campaigning in those states, instead focusing on North Carolina and Virginia. He was particularly successful among black and older voters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Elizabeth Warren lost her home state of Massachusetts, which is just brutal for her campaign.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Elizabeth Warren lost her home state of Massachusetts, which is just brutal for her campaign.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Warren also slips away, loses in her home state: Warren's loss in Massachusetts indicates a drop in support within her core support groups: women, liberal voters and white, college educated voters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's gotta hurt. And people are saying she might've split the progressive vote, especially since Klobuchar and Buttigieg dropped out and backed Biden.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's gotta hurt. And people are saying she might've split the progressive vote, especially since Klobuchar and Buttigieg dropped out and backed Biden.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some have accused her of splitting the vote among progressives, in contrast to centrist candidates Amy Klobuchar and Pete Buttigieg who rallied round Biden at the last minute.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's Mike Bloomberg—spent all that money, over half a billion on ads, and didn't win a single state.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's Mike Bloomberg-spent all that money, over half a billion on ads, and didn't win a single state.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: First time on the ballot, might be his last. Ouch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: First time on the ballot, might be his last. Ouch.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tuesday was his first appearance on the ballot, and could be his last if he drops out.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Sanders did manage to hold onto California though, with all those delegates. That's still a big prize.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sanders did manage to hold onto California though, with all those delegates. That's still a big prize.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sanders is projected to take California: The Golden State is the plum prize, with 415 delegates on the table, and Sanders, who went into the primary as the frontrunner, could win the majority of those, AP projects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but turnout among younger voters was down, even from 2016. That really hurt him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but turnout among younger voters was down, even from twenty sixteen. That really hurt him.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sanders is more popular among Latino and younger voters, but turnout among the latter fell short, even below 2016 levels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the markets seemed to like Biden's surge—Dow futures were up more than 2% Wednesday morning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the markets seemed to like Biden's surge-Dow futures were up more than two percent Wednesday morning.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden's win boosted U.S. stock futures, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average rising more than 2% on Wednesday morning, while S&P 500-linked futures also rose 2%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Investors definitely see him as more stable, I think that's the signal there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Investors definitely see him as more stable, I think that's the signal there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So overall, uh, a massive night for Biden, pretty rough for everyone else.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So overall, uh, a massive night for Biden, pretty rough for everyone else.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much reshaped the whole race in one evening.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much reshaped the whole race in one evening.

artist_script:
HostA: Joe Biden's comeback on Super Tuesday was just... staggering. I mean, his campaign was basically written off after New Hampshire.
HostB: Right? And he ended up winning eight states, including Texas, which was a huge upset over Bernie Sanders. He got 31% there to Bernie's 27.9%.
HostA: Yeah, and what’s wild is he barely even campaigned in some of those states—like Arkansas, Alabama, Minnesota...
HostB: Uh-huh, he focused on North Carolina and Virginia instead, and it clearly paid off. His support among black and older voters really carried him.
HostA: Meanwhile, Elizabeth Warren lost her home state of Massachusetts, which is just brutal for her campaign.
HostB: Yeah, that’s gotta hurt. And people are saying she might’ve split the progressive vote, especially since Klobuchar and Buttigieg dropped out and backed Biden.
HostA: And then there’s Mike Bloomberg—spent all that money, over half a billion on ads, and didn’t win a single state.
HostB: First time on the ballot, might be his last. Ouch.
HostA: Sanders did manage to hold onto California though, with all those delegates. That’s still a big prize.
HostB: True, but turnout among younger voters was down, even from 2016. That really hurt him.
HostA: And the markets seemed to like Biden’s surge—Dow futures were up more than 2% Wednesday morning.
HostB: Investors definitely see him as more stable, I think that’s the signal there.
HostA: So overall, uh, a massive night for Biden, pretty rough for everyone else.
HostB: Pretty much reshaped the whole race in one evening.
